title: Research scenario set Unit 1 - random assignment

content.description:
Researchers investigated the extent to which 30 pairs of identical and fraternal female twins shared with their twin a diagnosis for the eating disorder anorexia nervosa. Identical twins are genetically identical and share the same DNA pattern. Fraternal twins are only as genetically similar as any other sibling pair. Researchers found that 9 out of 16 pairs of the identical twins were diagnosed with anorexia nervosa, while 1 out of 14 pairs of the fraternal twins were diagnosed with anorexia nervosa.Â 

Holland, A.J., Hall, A., Murray, R., Russell, G.F., & Crisp, A.H. (1984). Anorexia nervosa: a study of 34 twin pairs and one set of triplets. British Journal of Psychiatry, 145, 414-419.
content.question: Which of the following explains why researchers could not implement an experimental design in this study?

choices.label: The twins could not be given a placebo.
The twins could not be randomly assigned to groups.
The twins could not be studied in an in-depth way individually.
Multiple studies of the twins could not be conducted over a long period and combined.

content.answer: The twins could not be randomly assigned to groups.

skill.text: 2.A: Determine the type of research design(s) used in a given study.
